permission_when_in_use.title: Warning
permission_when_in_use.message: If you don't allow to share location in the background, there is risk that your tracks will be incomplete. Please consider changing permission to "Allow always".

privacyPopup.title: Privacy
privacyPopup.message:
PLAY&GO

Information regarding the processing of personal data

Pursuant to Article 13 of the EU Regulation No. 2016/679 (GDPR), and in general in compliance with the principle of transparency set out in that Regulation, below we provide information regarding the processing of personal data within the Play&Go application (hereinafter "App").

The App allows tracking of integrated, multimodal mobility trips  (e.g., bus, train, bicycle, walking, carpooling, and combinations these).

It is worth pointing out that the App can also be used in the context of sustainable mobility campaigns to award points and prizes based on the trips correctly tracked by participants. In order to allow such campaigns to be carried out, it is necessary to collect and process information related to the tracking of trips made via the App.

This information is therefore to be considered supplementary to that which will be made available upon joining the various sustainable mobility campaigns proposed over time through the Play&Go App.

1. PURPOSE OF PROCESSING

The processing of personal data takes place within the App and will have the following purposes:

  1. register users and allow them to use the App;
  2. ensure the proper functioning of the App;
  3. enable the performance, documentation, and improvement of the App's activities;
  4. track and validate trips through the App;
  5. provide for scientific, historical, and statistical research purposes.

2. OBLIGATION TO PROVIDE DATA

The legal basis for processing is the explicit consent upon first use of the App.

All purposes of processing are related to the use of the App. Although there is no obligation to provide the data, failure to do so will make it impossible to proceed with access to the App and therefore to use it. With reference to geolocation, it should be noted that failure to consent to tracking could compromise the validation of your trips.

3. TYPE OF DATA PROCESSED

The following categories of data may be processed for the purposes of managing the App:

  1. personal data and contact details;
  2. geolocalization data (data on the user's position detected in real time, based on the GPS present on the mobile device on which the App is installed, while tracking a trip);
  3. behavior data (mode of travel, number of kilometers covered).

The user's public profile data (Google, Facebook, Apple, Smart Community) may be used to personalize the App.

The user's e-mail address is also used as a means to uniquely identify the user within the Smart Community systems.

4. METHODS OF DATA PROCESSING

The processing will be carried out:

  • through the App and the use of manual and automated systems;
  • by individuals authorized and trained to perform such tasks, in accordance with the law;
  • with the use of appropriate measures to ensure the confidentiality of data and prevent access to them by unauthorized third parties;
  • in contexts that do not undermine the personal dignity and decorum of the data subject, ensuring due care to guarantee confidentiality in their use.

You can consult all the technical and organizational measures adopted by FBK to ensure proportionality and necessity of the processing and prevent illegitimate access, unwanted modification, disappearance and explicit breaches of personal data at the following link bit.ly/MisureFBK.

No automated decision-making process is involved, nor any profiling activity.

5. DURATION OF TREATMENT

The data will be retained until the user requests its deletion and, in any case, for a period not exceeding that necessary for the fulfillment the obligations or tasks referred to in point 1, and in any case for pursuing the specific purposes indicated therein. The deletion of the data will occur gradually, based on the exhaustion of the individual purposes for which they were collected.

In some cases, the data may also be retained after the account is closed, such as in backups or in the Disaster Recovery system, or in aggregated and anonymized form, for scientific research purposes.

6. COMMUNICATION OF DATA

The data collected and processed may be communicated exclusively for the above mentioned purposes and in aggregate form, to Public Administrations (for example as promoters of sustainable mobility initiatives).

Personal data are not subject to dissemination.

For the exclusive purposes of scientific dissemination of statistical and/or scientific results (e.g., through publication of scientific articles, participation in conferences, etc.), data may be disseminated in anonymous and aggregate form and always in a manner that does not make the Data Subject identifiable.

7. PLACE OF DATA PROCESSING

The processing personal data takes place on the territory of the European Union, or with the help of IT tools involving processing in countries for which the European Commission has taken a decision on the adequacy of the protection of personal data or, failing that, through the signing of Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC) for data protection adopted by the European Commission with the supplier.

8. RIGHTS OF THE DATA SUBJECT

The Data Subject has the right to ask the Data Controller at any time to exercise the rights set out in Articles 15 et seq. of the GDPR and, in particular, to:

  • request confirmation of the existence or non-existence of their personal data and request access to them;
  • obtain information about the purposes of the processing, the categories of personal data, the recipients or categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been or will be communicated and, when possible, the storage period;
  • obtain rectification and deletion of data;
  • obtain restriction of processing;
  • object to the processing at any time.

He or she also has the right to revoke his consent at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent given before revocation.

To exercise the above rights, please write to: privacy@fbk.eu. 

This is without prejudice to the right to send a complaint to the Garante per la protezione dei dati personali.

9. DATA CONTROLLER

The data controller for the processing of personal data is the Bruno Kessler Foundation, based in Trento, Italy, via Santa Croce, 77 – +39.0461.314.621-227 – segr.presidenza@fbk.eu

10. CONTACT DETAILS OF THE DATA PROTECTION OFFICER

The Data Controller has designated a Data Protection Officer (DPO) pursuant to Article 37 of the GDPR, who can be contacted through the following channels: +39.0461.314.370 – privacy@fbk.eu.

11. AMENDMENTS TO THIS POLICY

The Data Controller reserves the right to make, if necessary, appropriate changes to this Privacy Policy - currently updated to May 16, 2025 - giving the widest possible visibility to the Data Subjects.

detail.modalTeam:
This component shows the performance of your team compared to the most active and least active team this week .

The score of the less active team is shown on the left.

The score of the more active team is shown on the right.
The bar represents your position with respect to the two scores.

Values from {{dateFrom}} to {{dateTo }}:
detail.modalPersonal:

On the left, the score of the less active player is represented.

On the right, the score of the more active player.
The bar represents your position with respect to the two scores.

Values from {{dateFrom}} to {{dateTo }}:

prize.title: Prizes
prize.desc: The first prize will be awarded by right to the first player in the weekly eco-leaves ranking while the other prizes will be drawn at random among the top 50 classified players. Check the rules to find out which players can compete for the weekly prizes, such as cases of equality and other details on assignment methods and times are managed.

detail.limits_text:
The regulation provides for the following limits:
  • maximum 20 km per day;
  • maximum 250 km per month;
      • Once the limit is exceeded, the trips are not validated for the campaign and the reward is not recognized.

challenges.singleDesc: You activated a single challenge from {{from}} to {{to}}
challenges.choose_single: Choose one of the following challenge

info.title: Single challenge
info.body:
Each week you can choose only ONE single challenge and ONE couple challenge.
Once you have chosen a challenge, the other alternatives for that type disappear.
So when you activate a single challenge, the other possible single challenges proposed by the system disappear.

Similarly, when you activate a couple challenge, the alternatives disappear.

Each week the proposed challenges are renewed: depending on your level, you can receive up to a maximum of 3 single challenge proposals.

infogroup.title: Group challenges
infogroup.body:
Each week you can choose only ONE couple challenge.
Once you have chosen a challenge, the other alternatives for that type disappear.
So when you activate a couple challenge, the other possible couple challenges proposed by the system disappear.

Accepting an invitation is equivalent to choosing a couple challenge.

When someone accepts an invitation you sent, the couple challenge for the week is automatically chosen. All other alternate challenges disappear.

Each week the proposed challenges are renewed: depending on your level, you can receive up to a maximum of 3 invitations and you can send up to a maximum of 2 invitations.

stats.empty: If you want to see your challenges' statistics start to play!

create.title: Configure a challenge

create.sent_body: The invitation will be visible to {{nickname}}. You will get a notification if {{nickname}} accept or reject the challenge. If he will not reply before the time limit the challenge will be rejected automatically.
